meanings.definition: The action of placing one thing on top of another.
meanings.sent1: She carefully created a superposition of books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The superposition of plates on the table made it look cluttered.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he attempted a superposition of hats on his head.
meanings.sent4: The superposition of flavors in the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent5: The superposition of colors in the painting made it vibrant and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: The combination of two or more waves to form a new wave.
meanings.sent1: The superposition of sound waves created a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the superposition of waves to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The superposition of ocean waves on the shore sounded like a symphony.
meanings.sent4: The superposition of light waves in the spectrum produced a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: His explanation of superposition of waves was clear and easy to grasp.
